p: Several reports on the composition of volatile oils from T. polium are found in literature. In the oil from T. polium collected in Athens (Greece), β-caryophyllene(17.7%) was shown to be the major constituent accompanied by δ- cadinene (9.3%), caryophyllene oxide (5.9%) and α- cadinol (5.4%) ( 25). The oil of T. polium subsp. valentinum from Spain, was found to contain α-pinene (15.8%) and β-pinene (11.7%) as major constituents ( 26). α-Muurolene (8.7%), α- cadinol (5.9%) and δ-cadinene (5.1%) were found to be the major constituents of the essential oil of T. polium from northern region of Saudi Arabia ( 27). The dominant compounds in T. polium from Corsica were α- pinene (28.8 %), β- pinene (7.2%), and p-cymene (7.0%) ( 28).
